title: Wales make back row changes to face Fiji with James Davies starting at flanker
text:
Wales have made two changes to their starting XV for Wednesday’s fixture against Fiji in Oita, re-jigging their back row with flanker James Davies making his Rugby World Cup debut.

Davies replaces Justin Tipuric, who is not injured but has been rested in order for Davies to build up his match sharpness after not being selected in Wales’ first two matches.

Further alterations to the back row see Josh Navidi move to blindside flanker, with Ross Morarity coming in at No 8 as Aaron Wainwright drops to the bench.

The only other change to the matchday squad that defeated Australia is the selection of Saracens prop Rhys Carre, who replaces Nicky Smith among the replacements.

description: Wales have made two changes to their starting XV for Wednesday’s fixture against Fiji in Oita, re-jigging their back row with flanker James Davies making his Rugby World Cup debut.
